alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 12:38AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cherry and northeastern Sheridan Counties through 1230 AM MDT... At 1138 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Pine Ridge to near Gordon to 10 miles east of Rushville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Merriman, Hoover Lake, Lone Butte, Highway 61 Crossing The Niobrara River, Irwin, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Bayonne and Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 99 and 141. Highway 61 between mile markers 214 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM MDT for the Panhandle of and north central Nebraska.
